00005 """Visual Studio user preferences file writer."""
00006 
00007 import os
00008 import re
00009 import socket # for gethostname
00010 
00011 import gyp.common
00012 import gyp.easy_xml as easy_xml

00015 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00016 
00017 def _FindCommandInPath(command):
00018   """If there are no slashes in the command given, this function
00019      searches the PATH env to find the given command, and converts it
00020      to an absolute path.  We have to do this because MSVS is looking
00021      for an actual file to launch a debugger on, not just a command
00022      line.  Note that this happens at GYP time, so anything needing to
00023      be built needs to have a full path."""
00024   if '/' in command or '\\' in command:
00025     # If the command already has path elements (either relative or
00026     # absolute), then assume it is constructed properly.
00027     return command
00028   else:
00029     # Search through the path list and find an existing file that
00030     # we can access.
00031     paths = os.environ.get('PATH','').split(os.pathsep)
00032     for path in paths:
00033       item = os.path.join(path, command)
00034       if os.path.isfile(item) and os.access(item, os.X_OK):
00035         return item
00036   return command
00037 
00038 def _QuoteWin32CommandLineArgs(args):
00039   new_args = []
00040   for arg in args:
00041     # Replace all double-quotes with double-double-quotes to escape
00042     # them for cmd shell, and then quote the whole thing if there
00043     # are any.
00044     if arg.find('"') != -1:
00045       arg = '""'.join(arg.split('"'))
00046       arg = '"%s"' % arg
00047 
00048     # Otherwise, if there are any spaces, quote the whole arg.
00049     elif re.search(r'[ \t\n]', arg):
00050       arg = '"%s"' % arg
00051     new_args.append(arg)
00052   return new_args
00053 
00054 class Writer(object):
00055   """Visual Studio XML user user file writer."""
00056 
00057   def __init__(self, user_file_path, version, name):
00058     """Initializes the user file.
00059 
00060     Args:
00061       user_file_path: Path to the user file.
00062       version: Version info.
00063       name: Name of the user file.
00064     """
00065     self.user_file_path = user_file_path
00066     self.version = version
00067     self.name = name
00068     self.configurations = {}
00069 
00070   def AddConfig(self, name):
00071     """Adds a configuration to the project.
00072 
00073     Args:
00074       name: Configuration name.
00075     """
00076     self.configurations[name] = ['Configuration', {'Name': name}]
00077 
00078   def AddDebugSettings(self, config_name, command, environment = {},
00079                        working_directory=""):
00080     """Adds a DebugSettings node to the user file for a particular config.
00081 
00082     Args:
00083       command: command line to run.  First element in the list is the
00084         executable.  All elements of the command will be quoted if
00085         necessary.
00086       working_directory: other files which may trigger the rule. (optional)
00087     """
00088     command = _QuoteWin32CommandLineArgs(command)
00089 
00090     abs_command = _FindCommandInPath(command[0])
00091 
00092     if environment and isinstance(environment, dict):
00093       env_list = ['%s="%s"' % (key, val)
00094                   for (key,val) in environment.iteritems()]
00095       environment = ' '.join(env_list)
00096     else:
00097       environment = ''
00098 
00099     n_cmd = ['DebugSettings',
00100              {'Command': abs_command,
00101               'WorkingDirectory': working_directory,
00102               'CommandArguments': " ".join(command[1:]),
00103               'RemoteMachine': socket.gethostname(),
00104               'Environment': environment,
00105               'EnvironmentMerge': 'true',
00106               # Currently these are all "dummy" values that we're just setting
00107               # in the default manner that MSVS does it.  We could use some of
00108               # these to add additional capabilities, I suppose, but they might
00109               # not have parity with other platforms then.
00110               'Attach': 'false',
00111               'DebuggerType': '3',  # 'auto' debugger
00112               'Remote': '1',
00113               'RemoteCommand': '',
00114               'HttpUrl': '',
00115               'PDBPath': '',
00116               'SQLDebugging': '',
00117               'DebuggerFlavor': '0',
00118               'MPIRunCommand': '',
00119               'MPIRunArguments': '',
00120               'MPIRunWorkingDirectory': '',
00121               'ApplicationCommand': '',
00122               'ApplicationArguments': '',
00123               'ShimCommand': '',
00124               'MPIAcceptMode': '',
00125               'MPIAcceptFilter': ''
00126              }]
00127 
00128     # Find the config, and add it if it doesn't exist.
00129     if config_name not in self.configurations:
00130       self.AddConfig(config_name)
00131 
00132     # Add the DebugSettings onto the appropriate config.
00133     self.configurations[config_name].append(n_cmd)
00134 
00135   def WriteIfChanged(self):
00136     """Writes the user file."""
00137     configs = ['Configurations']
00138     for config, spec in sorted(self.configurations.iteritems()):
00139       configs.append(spec)
00140 
00141     content = ['VisualStudioUserFile',
00142                {'Version': self.version.ProjectVersion(),
00143                 'Name': self.name
00144                },
00145                configs]
00146     easy_xml.WriteXmlIfChanged(content, self.user_file_path,
00147                                encoding="Windows-1252")
